title: Scenarios: understanding 'what if…' (without predicting the future)

questions.explanation: It's meant to understand sensitivity, not to guess the future.

questions.prompt: The 'market drop' scenario is used to:

choices.text: See the impact of a stock decline

questions.explanation: It makes the relationship between allocation and potential decline visible.

choices.text: The impact of CAD/USD/EUR exchange rates

questions.explanation: It shows that your result can shift even if the asset price doesn't change.

choices.text: To prepare your decisions and understand your risk

questions.explanation: The goal is to decide more calmly by understanding the consequences.

questions.prompt: True/False: a scenario is useful even if you don't know whether it will happen.
questions.explanation: It helps you prepare coherent responses, not be certain.
